title: Multiple Issues related to registering applications

profile.name: Coinbase
profile.about: Creating an open financial system for the world

vulnerability_information:
On the page https://coinbase.com/oauth/applications, an authenticated coinbase user can create an application and successfully submit it to the app gallery. 
 
After submitting, the app is pending review to be approved. However, while the app is in review, the coinbase user can send a URL (something like https://coinbase.com/apps/533fb2cb6e90eb79b9000103) to access the app to other users directly. In other words, the app is accessible to other users even without being reviewed by the coinbase team. The coinbase user might have malicious intentions and can trick other users to install the malicious app. 

Other users can also leave their reviews on this application. 

Lastly, after submitting an app for approval, there is an option to upload screenshots. There did not seem to be any restrictions on the kind of files that can be uploaded. I was able to upload an executable and I got a message saying it was successfully uploaded. I could not verify it because I believe it will only be visible once approved.
vulnerability_information_html:
On the page https://coinbase.com/oauth/applications, an authenticated coinbase user can create an application and successfully submit it to the app gallery.

After submitting, the app is pending review to be approved. However, while the app is in review, the coinbase user can send a URL (something like https://coinbase.com/apps/533fb2cb6e90eb79b9000103) to access the app to other users directly. In other words, the app is accessible to other users even without being reviewed by the coinbase team. The coinbase user might have malicious intentions and can trick other users to install the malicious app.

Other users can also leave their reviews on this application.

Lastly, after submitting an app for approval, there is an option to upload screenshots. There did not seem to be any restrictions on the kind of files that can be uploaded. I was able to upload an executable and I got a message saying it was successfully uploaded. I could not verify it because I believe it will only be visible once approved.

activities.message: Hello, click that link provides me with a 404 page can you confirm this link works for other users? If that link wasn't meant to be a proof of concept can you please send a working PoC?
activities.markdown_message: Hello, click that link provides me with a 404 page can you confirm this link works for other users? If that link wasn't meant to be a proof of concept can you please send a working PoC?
Try this one - https://coinbase.com/apps/53434ec9a280bd2c33000048

activities.message:
So, I rechecked this again. The URL is accessible only till the app is in review. As soon as its rejected, the link would obviously not work. So, in order to reproduce this, please follow the instructions below:

1. Login as user A. 

2. Navigate to https://coinbase.com/oauth/applications.

3. Create an application and click on "Submit to app gallery".

4. On the next screen, enter the required information. Enter a bogus URL that you want users to get redirected to/install.

5. Click on "Create app". Notice the message  "Your application was succesfully submitted for review. Please add screenshots below." Also, notice that you can upload screenshots and the extensions are not being validated so you can basically upload executables as well.

6. So, now while the app is currently being reviewed, click on "Preview app" on the same page. Copy the URL and send it to user B.

7. User B on authenticating to the coinbase site, when accesses the above URL will be taken to the app page even though the app is still in review phase.

8. Notice that user B can install the app, can be redirected to the A's website, can write reviews - all this even though the app is not been accepted yet. 

Notice 2 screenshots attached. 1 is from user A who created the application. The other screenshot is from user B who was able to access the application and write reviews even though the app has not been accepted.
activities.markdown_message:
So, I rechecked this again. The URL is accessible only till the app is in review. As soon as its rejected, the link would obviously not work. So, in order to reproduce this, please follow the instructions below:

  1. Login as user A.

  2. Navigate to https://coinbase.com/oauth/applications.

  3. Create an application and click on "Submit to app gallery".

  4. On the next screen, enter the required information. Enter a bogus URL that you want users to get redirected to/install.

  5. Click on "Create app". Notice the message "Your application was succesfully submitted for review. Please add screenshots below." Also, notice that you can upload screenshots and the extensions are not being validated so you can basically upload executables as well.

  6. So, now while the app is currently being reviewed, click on "Preview app" on the same page. Copy the URL and send it to user B.

  7. User B on authenticating to the coinbase site, when accesses the above URL will be taken to the app page even though the app is still in review phase.

  8. Notice that user B can install the app, can be redirected to the A's website, can write reviews - all this even though the app is not been accepted yet.

Notice 2 screenshots attached. 1 is from user A who created the application. The other screenshot is from user B who was able to access the application and write reviews even though the app has not been accepted.

activities.message: Any updates on this? Were you able to reproduce?
activities.markdown_message: Any updates on this? Were you able to reproduce?

activities.message:
Hi Ryan,

I believe I reported 3 issues earlier. Their statuses are:

Issue # 1:
Any coinbase user can create an app and submit it for review. He can then lure other coinbase users to view his app and get redirected or install malicious files by sending them the app URL. 

Status:
This appears to be fixed now as other coinbase users are not able to view the app by accessing the URL sent by the original user. They see a 404 Page Not Found error.

Issue # 2:
Other coinbase users can leave comments/write reviews on the original coinbase user's app even though the app is still being reviewed. 

Status:
This appears to be fixed now as other coinbase users are not able to access the app URL sent by the original user. If they can't access the URL, they cannot really leave any review/feedback. 

Having said that, I did not record the request (to write reviews) that I sent earlier to exploit this in the first place. Hence, I could not replay that request to verify that this has been fixed completely. I cannot say for sure if this has been mitigated by making the app URL inaccessible and hence no place to write reviews OR if this has been mitigated by performing authorization checks to ensure that unauthorized users are not allowed to write reviews for applications that have not been published yet.
 
Either ways, I am not able to reproduce this anymore. But, I would still cross-check to be sure that proper fixes have been implemented.

Issue # 3:
After creating, saving and submitting an app for approval, there is an option to upload screenshots. There did not seem to be any restrictions on the kind of files that can be uploaded. I was able to upload an executable and I got a message saying it was successfully uploaded. I could not verify if the file was really uploaded or not because I believe it will only be visible once it has been approved. But, it did seem that it was successfully uploaded. I am attaching a pic to display this option.

Status:
This does not appear to be fixed. I am still getting a message saying that screenshot has been added when I try to upload files of various extensions. There also doesn't seem to be any sort of file size sanity check. I would make sure I cross-check this again. 

Please let me know if there are any questions.

Thanks,
Anshuman
activities.markdown_message:
Hi Ryan,

I believe I reported 3 issues earlier. Their statuses are:

Issue # 1:
Any coinbase user can create an app and submit it for review. He can then lure other coinbase users to view his app and get redirected or install malicious files by sending them the app URL.

Status:
This appears to be fixed now as other coinbase users are not able to view the app by accessing the URL sent by the original user. They see a 404 Page Not Found error.

Issue # 2:
Other coinbase users can leave comments/write reviews on the original coinbase user's app even though the app is still being reviewed.

Status:
This appears to be fixed now as other coinbase users are not able to access the app URL sent by the original user. If they can't access the URL, they cannot really leave any review/feedback.

Having said that, I did not record the request (to write reviews) that I sent earlier to exploit this in the first place. Hence, I could not replay that request to verify that this has been fixed completely. I cannot say for sure if this has been mitigated by making the app URL inaccessible and hence no place to write reviews OR if this has been mitigated by performing authorization checks to ensure that unauthorized users are not allowed to write reviews for applications that have not been published yet.

Either ways, I am not able to reproduce this anymore. But, I would still cross-check to be sure that proper fixes have been implemented.

Issue # 3:
After creating, saving and submitting an app for approval, there is an option to upload screenshots. There did not seem to be any restrictions on the kind of files that can be uploaded. I was able to upload an executable and I got a message saying it was successfully uploaded. I could not verify if the file was really uploaded or not because I believe it will only be visible once it has been approved. But, it did seem that it was successfully uploaded. I am attaching a pic to display this option.

Status:
This does not appear to be fixed. I am still getting a message saying that screenshot has been added when I try to upload files of various extensions. There also doesn't seem to be any sort of file size sanity check. I would make sure I cross-check this again.

Please let me know if there are any questions.

Thanks,
Anshuman

activities.message:
Hey Anshuman - 

#3 isn't really relevant because those files aren't executed or accessible to users. Arbitrary upload behaviors aren't valid for bounties unless they are executed by the server or similarly exploitable.

Since the other issues are fixed, resolving. Thanks!

Since the other issues are fixed, resolving. Thanks!
